column4: i have /etc/default/wpasupplicant but no /etc/wpa_supplicant.conf
is wpasupplicant the same as wpa_supplicant?
yes... although I've been thinking about it since I told you that.  I'm not 100% sure if its used for WEP encryption
from the research I've done so far it seems like it is
whats your wireless card?
broadcom b43
ah
what driver are you using? (I have the same card, btw)
I already extracted the firmware, etc.
I was using one that was called something like Broadcom B43 Wireless and now when I look at my hardware it just says wl
i've tried about 20 different solutions at this point, so I'm sure there is some sort of mess that needs to be cleaned up
at least now i can connect to unsecured wireless
does the STA wireless driver require wpa_supplicant?
when you go into restricted drivers what does it say?
the STA driver is new in 2.6.24-21
ok I'm using 2.6.24-22.  need to figure out how to install it
what does the restricted drivers say
system > administration > restricted drivers
where is restricted drivers??? I don't see it in Administration
in that case, the only thing that shows up there is wl
it should be showing up, perhaps you need to upgrade jockey
could it have to do with blacklisting bcm43xx?
possibly
